repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Sulawesi Agricultural Area
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings show an unsatisfactory
            outcome, and unlikely sustainability, although institutional
            development impacts are modest. Several lessons address the
            following. The modest incremental resources brought by the
            project, not sufficient to resolve systemic institutional
            issues in research, extension, supervision, and maintenance
            of rural works, farm credit, livestock health, and local
            government finance, among others, reinforces the need for a
            focused, simple project design. Conceptually, it is more
            attractive to have an integrated approach, but experience
            suggests the approach is sometimes difficult to implement,
            often unnecessary, as this case conveys, research support
            was not required given research programs had been given
            adequate support. This is why a flexible project management,
            able to adjust implementation timing, while balancing
            project activities, could have eased the difficult
            interagency coordination, as well as a timely project
            restructuring. Regarding project implementation,
            community-based civil works, such as village roads, small
            bridges, village irrigation canals, and village water
            supply, while appreciated by beneficiaries, the maintenance
            of such infrastructure has often been unsatisfactory,
            because it is often regarded by the community as project
            activities, as if maintenance belongs to local governments.
            And, despite success in pioneering aspects of
            community-managed micro-finance to the poor following
            restructuring, much still needs to be done to ensure
            financial sustainability, and institutional independence
            from government.

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Sulawesi Agricultural Area
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall objectives of the Sulawesi
            Agricultural Area Development Project are to assist the
            government in reducing the incidence of poverty in the
            provinces of Central and Southeast Sulawesi through the
            increase of rural incomes, the promotion of equitable
            regional development, the promotion of environmentally
            sustainable farming practices, and the strengthening of
            local level institutions. The specific objectives of the
            project are to: 1) increase farmer productivity and incomes;
            2) promote environmentally sustainable farming practices;
            and 3) improve the capacity of local institutions to
            identify, prepare, appraise and manage agricultural
            development programs. The project has three broad
            components: 1) agriculture-based area development, including
            a crop development program, livestock management and
            veterinary care, farm access roads, and community based
            initiatives; 2) project management and capacity
            strengthening of local agricultural support services
            comprising the rehabilitation and improvement of facilities,
            training, workshops, seminars, and technical assistance; and
            3) farming systems and fisheries research support and
            technology transfer.
